reviewText: Extremly simple physics based 'ball' game. The presentation is neat, but that's about all going for the game. The game itself is bland, very bland. You control three Adorables that can shoot in a direction of your choice in turns. Your opponent has another three Adorables that do the same. There are three modes that are essentially the same: Soccer, Ice Hockey and Beach Ball. Then there's Last Man Standing and Mummy (which are basically the same thing). The last mode is capture the flag. All modes play almost the same and there are no specials to lighten up the rather boring game play.\n\nIf you like very simple turned based physics games this might be worth to pick up in a sale or a bundle, but otherwise I wouldn't bother to get it.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Cute carrom-based strategy game for all ages
- You control a team of 3 players, where the aim is to beat the other team. You do this by specifying in each turn, how you want your 3 players to move.

- There are a few different game types to choose from: e.g. soccer, ice hockey, capture the flag, escape the mummy, knock your opponent into the water, etc, and you can choose to play in practice mode, online vs, hotseat, world tournament, etc.

- The goals of each game differ depending on the type of game you select. E.g. In capture the flag"
date: you must get to the other team's home base
hoursPlayed: and bring it back to your base
voteText: while making your own flag isn't captured first. And in "escape the mummy"
helpfulPercent: you must try to make the mummy turn all the players on your opponent's team into mummies themselves
votesHelpful:
while making sure you have at least 1 player still alive on your own team.


Game mechanics
- Movement is free anywhere within the game board as long as there are no obstacles in the way.

- On each turn
votesTotal: you can specify 1 linear direction in which you want your player to move
votesFunny:
as well as the amount of force.

- You can also choose not to move any of your players per turn.

- If players bump into objects (i.e. game board items and other players)
commentsCount: they will rebound.\n\n- I had no problems at all playing this game using my mouse
column16:
on my laptop.


Strategy
While kids may enjoy the cute graphics & sound and appreciate the simple physics involved
column17: more mature players soon realise that
column19: you have to take into account how the other team is going to move
column20: and also in which direction all players will "rebound" when they hit stuff.\n\nDifferent game types require different methods of strategising. E.g. In "capture the flag"
column21:
you may find it beneficial to not move 1 of your players and have it permanently stationed at your home base instead.


Conclusion
Adorables operates fundamentally like carrom
column22: but with more options and a variety of interesting contexts.\nThis really is an adorable game that I would recommend to both kids & adults alike. I can see kids enjoying the colourful
column24:
and adults having fun thinking up various strategies to beat each game type.


Disclaimer: Game received for free
column25: thanks to my dear friend Unpageable. :)"

reviewText:
Product received for free

It might be fun if I played it on my smartphone while being bored in a bus. It is no fun at all playing it on Steam.

There are 6 minigames in total in Adorables: soccer, beach ball, hockey, capture the flag, push off opponents to water and running away from a mummy. Soccer, beach ball and hockey can be considered as one minigame since the only difference is a friction of a ground (the ball and creatures moves faster or slower). Scoring in these requires more luck than skills. Capture the flag, pushing off and mummy are slightly more interesting, though after a moment it is way too easy to win.
Yes, AI sucks badly in this game. Opponents follow blindly ball putting it to their own goals or in case of a hockey, they stuck behind goals unable to move.

If you actually want to spend 2,99€ for this game, I strongly recommend getting it for absolutely free from Google Play.

Both sides tired of all the dead they both had (even after a mass nuclear explosion they experienced), they decided that every conflict would be solved in a game of life and death.

The winner, would honor their nation and get all the ♥♥♥♥♥es he wants. The loser, not only would burn to death but would see all of his family getting ♥♥♥♥♥ by the opposite side.

And it has been like that forever, on this universe the mutant creatures don't even take the games serious anymore unless it is a really good oponent and some are just in to punch each other with no clothes at all (which led to most of the creatures turning themselves homosexuals)

Cons:

reviewText:
Product received for free

Adorables is a mixed, yet leaning towards yes, game in my eyes.
It's a lot of fun to play from time to time, yet not vey fun in long bursts. As fun as it is, it's very easy to tell that everything but the visuals was done very low-budget and was rushed. The game plays fine, but somethig about it just fells like it could and should be done better. maybe it's that animation feels stiff or unfitting to the gameplay, maybe it's that the pacing of the game is just really slow, maybe it's the mobile buttons all around the game, there's just something about it I dont like. However, this game has variety in SPADES. wanna play soccer? sure! Wanna play some CTF? They got you covered! Wanna play some Last Man Standing games, both Player vs Player and Player vs Environment? Boom. Add in World tour, Tourney, and both LAN/servered and local multiplayer and you have a decently solid game.

PROS:
Dumb Fun
Amazing graphics and cosmetic design
Variety to an insane degree

CONS:
No dedicated servers
not much AI progression in tourney mode
Something about it feels lazy:
Feels like a mobile port at times.

Overall this game gets a 6.3/10 for me. Wait for a sale or it to be free
recommended: maybe just get it if your looking for a few hours of fun

reviewText:
Adorables:
~~~~~~~~

Let me ask you this question ladies and Gents . . . what has a round body shape, cute little round limbs, small mouth and one huge eye? Well. . . come on, what is it? It is the Adorable of course, and they are just waiting for you to come and play with them.

Adorable is a casual/strategy/sports/online game for all ages. This game will offer you five modes to test your skills with these adorable creatures across three different sports: Capture the Flag, the Last Adorable Standing, and the Mummy Events. The sporting events are Football (Soccer for my Aussie and American friends), Beach Football and Ice Hockey. In these sports you have to score three goals to win the game. You have to capture your opponent’s flag three times to win in the Capture the Flag game. In the Last Adorable Standing (please use a slightly Austrian accent when reading it), you will be on a platoon and you will have to get rid of the three adorable opponents by sending them off for a swim. In the Mummy Event, all you have to do is to make sure your Adorables are not touched by the Mummy.

How do you control your Adorables? Well, it is like a turn base setup. Let’s take the example of the Football. Each turn you will assign each Adorable in which direction they will travel via an arrow attached to them. You can choose how fast your Adorable will travel by stretching the arrow as fast as you can toward the direction. When you are ready to end the turn, all Adorables (yours and your opponent’s Adorables) will launch themselves towards their specific directions and you might think you are playing a game of billiards.

Every time you win a game, you will be awarded with coins which you can use towards customizing your Adorables, from body shape, mouth and eyes to different colours.  The only option missing is the ability to save your progress or just have auto save.

The graphics are cute and adorable. Catchy music (cute) and the controls are easy to use and master.

Positives:
~~~~~~~

-	Adorable graphics
-	6 modes to play including online
-	Fun customisation
-	Fun and addictive
-	Good price point
-	Achievements and trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~

-	No Saving options
-	Repetitive

Adorables is a fun, addictive and casual game for all ages!

7.5/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

MORE THE_CPT_FROGGY REVIEWS HERE

FOLLOW THE CPT FROGGY CURATOR PAGE HERE
